text.section: A person who violates the provisions of Title 20, Subtitle 2 of this article as they relate to the minority business enterprise utilization program by committing a prohibited act listed under § 14-308 of the State Finance and Procurement Article, on conviction, is subject to the penalties provided under that section.
A person who violates emergency water use restrictions adopted in accordance with § 17-403 of this article is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $500.
A person who violates Title 18, Subtitle 1 of this article (Personnel Management) is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $500.
A person who violates § 19-102(b) of this article (ethics) is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 1 year or a fine not exceeding $1,000 or both.
A person may be convicted of a second or subsequent violation of a provision of this Division II or a regulation adopted under this Division II.
